courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Putonghua as a Second Language Taster Course for International Students
courses.description:
“This course is offered via asynchronous online mode. Students should register the course via KEEP, a CUHK eLearning platform where the course materials are uploaded.”

CLCP1001 is an asynchronous online taster course for international students who are interested in studying Putonghua. Students will be systematically introduced to Chinese characters (formation, history, stroke orders, etc.). Additionally, students will have a chance to learn some basic daily conversations in Putonghua.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for stu who have taken any CLCP courses (exceptCLCP1112,1113,1123) or any CLCC courses for PTH-speaking stu
From 2023-24, stu can only earn up to 2 units from CLCP1001,CLCP1101,CLCC1001,CLCC1101,JASP1350,HKSL1001,SPAN1001,GERM1001,KORE1001,FREN1001
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations
(R1) understand basic knowledge of Chinese characters (e.g. radicals, stroke order, etc.) and read commonly used basic vocabulary and phrases

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應
(R1) 掌握漢字的基本知識（例如，部首、筆順等），能閱讀常用基礎詞彙及短語
courses.course_syllabus: In this taster course, around 80 commonly used Chinese characters will be introduced in the context of basic daily conversations. The selected characters introduce some commonly seen radicals, such as the water radical, mouth radical, female radical, hand radical, etc. Topics covered in the daily conversations include: greetings, self-introductions, asking for directions, etc.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.
courses.recommended_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Putonghua Taster Course for Local Students
courses.description:
[This course is offered via asynchronous online mode. Students should register the course via KEEP, a CUHK eLearning platform where the course materials are uploaded.]

CLCP1101 is an asynchronous online taster course for local students who are interested in studying Putonghua at CUHK. Students will explore different scenarios of Putonghua in use through various multimedia sources. Special attention will be drawn to usage in different registers.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for stu who have taken CLCP1703 or above,or any CLCC courses which are for PTH-speaking stu
From 2023-24, students can only earn up to 2 units of these courses: CLCP1001,CLCP1101,CLCC1001,CLCC1101,JASP1350,HKSL1001,SPAN1001,GERM1001,KORE1001,FREN1001
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life conversations with appropriate usage

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要
(S&L2) 運用所學詞彙和句式完成簡短的成段對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
courses.course_syllabus: In this taster course, several selected scenarios will be presented and examples will demonstrate casual Putonghua, semi-formal Putonghua, and formal Putonghua in use. The scenarios include: self-introductions, talking about hobbies, discussing university majors, and expressing thank you and goodbye.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar I
courses.description: A beginners’ Putonghua course designed for international students with no Chinese background. The course teaches Putonghua pronunciation, Chinese characters, and basic vocabulary and grammar for daily usage.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken CLCP1113 or CLCP1133 or above.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:
1. Use the pinyin romanization system to read and look up Chinese characters;
2. Read simple sentences written with Chinese characters;
3. Understand and reply to simple spoken sentences.

完成本課程後，學生將能夠：
1. 使用拼音認讀及查找漢字；
2. 閱讀用漢字書寫的簡單句子；
3. 聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應。
courses.course_syllabus:
Students will learn vocabulary and grammar in the following topics:
1. Self-introductions
2. Family and friends
3. Locations and positions
4. Daily activities
5. Talking about time
6. Food and drinks
7. Giving the price
8. Modes of transportation
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Textbook chapters and lecture notes.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Application of Vocabulary and Grammar I
courses.description: A beginners’ reading and writing course in Putonghua, focusing on acquiring elementary level vocabulary and grammar. Students are introduced to the romanization system of Putonghua (Pinyin) and the Chinese writing system (Chinese characters). Content covered in the course is based on daily situations. Appropriateness in application is emphasised.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken CLCP1132,CLCP1133/CPTH1133 or above
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations
(R2) master Chinese characters commonly used in daily life and read short sentences
(R3) read and understand sentences written with vocabulary and grammar learned in class
(W1) copy and write a small number of Chinese characters and vocabulary items
(W2) write Chinese characters commonly used in daily life and use Chinese characters to write short sentences

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應
(R2) 掌握生活中常用漢字，能閱讀簡短語句
(R3) 讀懂由所學詞彙和句式組成的句子
(W1) 抄寫及書寫少量漢字或詞語
(W2) 書寫生活中的常用漢字，使用漢字書寫簡短語句
courses.course_syllabus:
Students will learn vocabulary and grammar in the following topics:
1. Self-introductions
2. Family and friends
3. Locations and positions
4. Daily activities
5. Talking about time
6. Food and drinks
7. Giving the price
8. Modes of transportation
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Oral Skills Practice I
courses.description: A beginners’ listening and speaking course in Putonghua, focusing on completing linguistic tasks through oral communication. Students are introduced to the romanization system of Putonghua (Pinyin) and colloquial usage. Content covered in the course is based on everyday conversations and daily situations. Pragmatic knowledge in language use is also supplemented.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken CLCP1132,CLCP1133/CPTH1133 or above
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily conversations with appropriate usage
(S&L3) communicate fluently with selected vocabulary items and grammatical patterns at the sentence level in daily settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求
(S&L2) 將所學句式和詞彙組成簡短對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
(S&L3) 運用所學詞彙和句式在現實生活的不同語境中與人進行簡單的問答
courses.course_syllabus:
Students will have ample listening and speaking practice in the following topics:
1. Basic greetings
2. Detailed self-introductions
3. Looking for someone
4. Weekend plans
5. Inviting friends out
6. Ordering food and drinks
7. Shopping
8. Transportation and going home
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Preparation for HSK (Level II)
courses.description: An elementary Putonghua course designed for students who plan on taking the HSK (level II). This course prepares students for the exam by teaching vocabulary and grammar from the HSK level II test syllabus and equipping students with test-taking strategies. In addition to examination preparation, this course also enhances students’ listening, reading, and writing abilities in Putonghua through various learning activities.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite:CLCP1113 and CLCP1123
Not for students who have taken CLCP2213 or above
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students will:
1. Be familiar with the structure, requirements, and procedures of the exam;
2. Be able to comprehend written and spoken Putonghua based on the contents covered in the course;
3. Be able to use the vocabulary and grammar covered in the course to express themselves in written form.

完成本科目後，學生將能夠：
1. 熟悉HSK二級考試的形式、要求及考試流程；
2. 閱讀或聽懂與本科目所涵蓋話題相關的文本或對話；
3. 運用本科目教授的詞彙及語法進行書面表達。
courses.course_syllabus:
Course topics include: traveling, daily routines, looking for jobs, giving advice, expressing one’s concern, asking for directions, etc.

科目內容包括：旅行計劃、日常計劃、求職、提供建議、表達關心、問路等。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Textbook chapters and lecture notes.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Elementary Putonghua
courses.description:
An elementary speaking course in Putonghua designed for students whose native language is Cantonese. The course aims to familiarise students with the Pinyin romanization system and the focus is on speaking practice based on everyday topics. Through systematic training on consonants, vowels, tones, phonetic identification, and comparisons between Putonghua and Cantonese terminologies, students will be able to use the Pinyin romanization system and be equipped with the skills to communicate with short phrases in Putonghua. Furthermore, students will be able to understand standard Putonghua upon completion of this course.

This course includes e-learning components, which not only provide targeted training on pronunciation and listening, but also allow students to complete online exercises, conduct recordings, and take examinations online or at the language laboratory.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken LEDC3520, CLED3530, or CLCP/CPTH2703 or above. Students are not allowed to take two levels of Putonghua in one term. Placement needed before registration.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO2: for levels 2-3) participate in simple conversations on predictable topics, obtain information by asking and answering questions, combine learned materials to convey meaning, and satisfy personal needs and social demands
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life conversations with appropriate usage

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要
(S&L2) 運用所學詞彙和句式完成簡短的成段對話並恰當地運用於日常生活之中
courses.course_syllabus:
Lesson topics include: self-introductions, making phone calls, asking for directions, ordering food, talking about one’s daily schedule, shopping, travelling, seeing a doctor, etc.

話題包括：自我介紹、打電話、問路、點菜、逛街、旅行、看病等。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Textbook chapters and supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

courses.description: An intermediate business course designed for students who have completed CLCP2213/CPTH2213. Course contents focus on building up students’ listening and reading abilities in daily and business settings, such as greeting clients, attending a welcome party, making hotel reservations, arranging a working schedule, etc.

(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life conversations with appropriate usage
(S&L3) communicate fluently with selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in short connected utterances in most real-life settings
(R2) read and understand paragraphs based on daily life written with familiar vocabulary and grammar

（學習成果：第二級和第三級）於預設話題中參與簡單的會話或討論，具備在對話中獲得信息的能力，並能結合所學內容與人溝通、滿足基本的交際需要

(S&L3) 運用所學詞彙和句式在現實生活的不同語境中與人進行有效的溝通
(R2) 讀懂由熟悉的字詞和句式組成的與日常生活相關的段落
courses.course_syllabus: CLCP2243 is an intermediate level business Chinese course. courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Intermediate Putonghua
courses.description:
An intermediate course in Putonghua designed for native speakers of Cantonese who already possess some foundational knowledge of Putonghua (including the Pinyin romanization system). The course targets common pronunciation problems for Cantonese speakers when speaking Putonghua and aims to strengthen students’ speaking ability so that they can express themselves at paragraph length on everyday topics.

Course contents focus on students’ ability to speak under a variety of real-life settings and present ideas in short, connected utterances. Activities conducted in class include training on pronunciation and evaluating differences between Putonghua and Cantonese expressions with reference to their communicative ability at paragraph level. Students will expand their vocabulary and be able to understand Putonghua spoken by native speakers and speakers with regional accents.

This course includes e-learning components, which not only provide targeted training on pronunciation and listening, but also allow students to complete online exercises, conduct recordings, and take examinations online or at the language laboratory.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken LEDC3520, CLED3530, CPTH3001 or CLCP3702, CLCP3703/CPTH3703 or above. Students are not allowed to take two levels of Putonghua in one term
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L1) understand and reply to professional discourse containing selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures in real-life settings

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L1) 具有一定的詞彙量，能聽懂正式場合中一般的交際對話
courses.course_syllabus:
Lesson topics include: studying abroad, changing jobs, saving up money, immigrating to Hong Kong, discussing technology, commenting on social media, etc.

話題包括：赴外留學、轉換工作、儲蓄、移居香港、科技、傳媒等。

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Learning Putonghua through Movies
courses.description: An advanced Putonghua course designed for native speakers of Cantonese who are interested in film. The course introduces students to popular films in Putonghua and film critique. Students will discuss the selected movies with their peers and introduce other movies with similar or contrasting themes and motifs. The course will increase students’ vocabulary and communicative competency in Putonghua.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: CLCP2703
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students will:
1. Gain knowledge on contemporary Chinese popular culture;
2. Master slang terms in Putonghua;
3. Understand Putonghua with regional accents.

完成本科目後，學生將能夠：
1. 增加對中國當代流行文化的了解；
2. 掌握一些地道的普通話表達方式及流行語；
3. 聽懂帶有不同方言口音的普通話。
courses.course_syllabus:
Course topics include:
1. Characteristics of Putonghua used in movies
2. Features of Putonghua used in dubbed films
3. Putonghua used in HK-produced movies
4. Differences in language use in movies from different eras
5. Putonghua of different regional varieties and different dialects used in movies
6. Popular sayings used in movies from different time periods

科目內容包括：
1. 華語電影語言特點簡析
2. 華語譯製片的語言特色
3. 港產片的普通話配音一窺
4. 不同時代影片的語言特點
5. 電影中的普通話與方言
6. 電影中的時代流行語
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review
courses.required_readings: Lecture notes and readings assigned by the teacher.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Advanced Putonghua
courses.description:
An advanced Putonghua course designed for students who have completed CLCP2703, CPTH2703, CPTH2001, or CPTH3001.The course is targeted at students who have the capability to present ideas in short, connected utterances. It will further build up students’ vocabulary related to social settings, especially developing their oral skills in delivering speeches at public occasions.

Course contents cover various social life topics. Through different real-life settings, students’ vocabulary will increase. Common pronunciation mistakes and differences between Putonghua and Cantonese words and phrases are included, which will allow students to present their ideas under a variety of circumstances, especially completing tasks in learning and working environments. Students will understand Putonghua with relatively strong accents.

This course includes e-learning components, which not only provide targeted training on pronunciation and listening, but also allow students to complete online exercises, conduct recordings, and take examinations online or at the language laboratory.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Pre-requisite: CLCP/CPTH2703/CPTH2001/3001
Not for students who have taken LEDC3520/CLED3530/CPTH4001
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
(PO3: for level 4) actively participate in conversations on various topics in some formal and most informal settings, handle a wide variety of linguistic tasks with communicative strategies, and effectively deal with unanticipated complications in communication, satisfying requirements of school and work situations
(S&L2) apply selected vocabulary items and grammatical structures at the discourse level in real-life professional conversations with appropriate usage

學生於完成本科時預期能：
（學習成果：第四級）具備參與在正式及非正式場合中交際的能力，能就不同話題發表意見，並根據不同交際場境調整談話策略，能完成學習或工作中常見的任務
(S&L2) 運用所學句式和詞彙做出得體應對，滿足在正式場合中的交際需要

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Learning Putonghua through Travelling
courses.description: An advanced Putonghua course designed for native speakers of Cantonese who want to learn more about different Chinese-speaking communities. The course is organised around several destinations in which Putonghua is used. Students will be introduced to the customs, traditions and tourist attractions of different parts of China and the Chinese diaspora. The course will increase students’ cultural awareness, vocabulary and communicative competence in Putonghua.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: CLCP2703
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:
1. Understand the complexities behind the Putonghua used in different regions;
2. Discuss the history, culture, and traditions of the destinations covered in the course in Putonghua;
3. Understand Putonghua with regional accents.

完成本科目後，學生將能夠：
1. 了解普通話在中國及其他華語社區的使用情況；
2. 用普通話討論本科目所涉及的目的地的歷史、文化和傳統；
3. 聽懂帶有不同口音的普通話。
courses.course_syllabus:
Course topics include:
1. Commonly-used Putonghua vocabulary and phrases related to traveling
2. Evolution of the official language in China
3. Differences between the Northeastern dialects and Standard Putonghua
4. Popular sayings of Putonghua in different regions
5. Differences between Mandarin used in Taiwan and Putonghua
6. Chinese used in Singapore and Malaysia

科目內容包括：
1. 旅遊相關的常用普通話詞彙
2. 中國官方通用語的演變
3. 東北方言與普通話的異同
4. 不同地區的普通話流行詞彙
5. 國語與普通話的差異

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Current Affairs and Discussion
courses.description:
An advanced course on special topics designed for students who have completed CLCP2703, CPTH2001, CPTH2703, or CPTH3001.

Course contents include news reporting and discussions on current affairs. Students’ speaking ability in both formal and informal situations will be enhanced through extracting, combining, and reproducing news contents. Furthermore, students will receive training in both formal standard written Chinese and spoken colloquial Putonghua. Discussion sessions on current affairs will enable students to learn a wide range of vocabulary on different topics and introduce differences between Putonghua and Cantonese words and phrases, enabling students to discuss current affairs happening around the world.

This course includes e-learning components, which not only provide targeted training on pronunciation and listening, but also allow students to complete online exercises, conduct recordings, and take examinations online or at the language laboratory.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Putonghua Speech Training (Presentation Skills and Test Preparation)
courses.description:
An advanced course on Putonghua examination preparation. The course is targeted at those at the advanced level who will be taking a public examination in Putonghua, such as the Putonghua Shuiping Ceshi (PSC), the Computerized Oral Proficiency Assessment (COPA), etc. This course is offered to students who have completed CLCP3703, CPTH3703, or CPTH4001.

Course contents include training on passage reading, various topics on vocabulary, grammar, and test-taking skills. A series of practice on different real-life settings will be provided. Students will learn more vocabulary and improve their reading and speaking skills in preparation for the examinations.

This course includes e-learning components, which not only provide targeted training on pronunciation and listening, but also allow students to complete online exercises, conduct recordings, and take examinations online or at the language laboratory.

Advisory: For local students speaking Cantonese or other Chinese dialects.

courses.subject: CLCP
courses.title: Pragmatic Internship in China (PRINCH, Advanced Level)
courses.description: PRINCH is a task-based course designed to provide advanced level students with the opportunity to use language in real life for real communication purposes. It allows students to practice what they have learned in class through a variety of activities in the target culture, focusing on topics related to social, political and economic issue. Class format consists of three parts: 1) Pre-trip activities with teachers; 2) Theme-based trip in small groups led by teachers or teaching assistants; and 3) Post-trip tasks with teachers, such as Q&A, discussion and presentation.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Pre-requisite:
1. An advanced course for students who have completed CLCP2703, CPTH2703 or above. 
2. For students who have not completed the above course, they are invited to join the Putonghua placement offered by CLA.

(R3) read and understand authentic articles related to daily life, culture, or society targeted at native Chinese speakers
(R4) read and understand professional articles on specific topics

courses.course_syllabus:
Topics
1. Education and policy 教育與政策
2. Religion and ethnicity 宗教與民族
3. History and tradition 歷史與傳統
4. Culture and media 文化與傳媒
5. Economy and business 經濟與商貿
6. Local living and folk customs 民生與民俗
7. Enterprise and rural areas 企業與農村
(To be confirmed based on places of visit)

Schedule
(tentative)
1st day: Topic: Local living and folk customs 民生與民俗
2nd day: Topic: History and tradition (I) 歷史與傳統 (一)
3rd day: Topic: Education and Policy (I) 教育與政策(一)
4th day: Topic: Economy and business 經濟與商貿
5th day: Self study 自修
6th day: Topic: Education and Policy (II) 教育與政策(二)
7th day: Topic: Enterprise and rural areas 企業與農村
8th day: Topic: Religion and ethnicity 宗教與民族
9th day: Topic: Culture and Media 文化與傳媒
10th day: Topic: History and tradition (II) 歷史與傳統 (二)
11th day: Final speech口頭報告
12th day: Final oral test 口試
(Requirements: Students are required to gain a basic linguistic competence and understanding of the place of visit in the pre-trip session, to join all the activities during the visit and prepare a related speech after the visit, and to deliver the speech and participate in the Q & A and discussion in the post-trip session on a daily basis and all in the target language.)

Pre-trip and post-trip sessions with the teachers in classrooms alone amount to 44 hours of training. On top of this, there will be many study trips to target sites such as companies, government departments, schools and universities, temples and mosques, museums and markets, etc., plus the extra speech preparation sessions with teachers and teaching assistance.

僅訪問前準備與訪問後討論和報告兩個在課堂上由教師教授的環節已佔44節以上課時。此外還有多次訪問活動（包括公司、政府部門、學校、宗教場所、博物館及市場等）以及演講稿預備環節。

Implication of Learning Activities
Explanation and discussion of linguistic functions and real life language practice activities. The former includes teaching of linguistic knowledge, topical discussions and presentations led by head teacher. The latter covers real life learning activities and will take place in Putonghua-speaking areas. Students can apply their linguistic knowledge to communicate and interact with locals.

Course content is theme-based, including history and tradition, religion and ethnicity, economy and business, local living and folk customs, culture and media, education and policy, as well as issues related to enterprise and rural areas.

本科目教學模式包括課堂活動及社會實踐兩部分。課堂活動包括語言知識的講解及教師引導下的討論和報告；實踐活動直接在真實語言環境中進行。通過與當地人的直接溝通交流，學生可以在實踐中運用在課堂上學到的語言知識與交際技巧。

話題：歷史與傳統、宗教與民族、經濟與商貿、民生與民俗、文化與傳媒、教育與政策、企業與農村。
